trans-unit.source: Provides properties for getting information about the format and configuration of the mouse installed on the local computer.
The `My.Computer.Mouse` object provides a way to find information about the computer's mouse: whether the mouse buttons are swapped, and details about the mouse wheel.

Availability by Project Type ||| |-|-| |Project type|Available| |Windows Application|**Yes**| |Class Library|**Yes**| |Console Application|**Yes**| |Windows Control Library|**Yes**| |Web Control Library|No| |Windows Service|**Yes**| |Web Site|No|
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Mouse"></xref> class.
Gets a <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> that indicates if the functionality of the left and right mouse buttons has been swapped.
The `My.Computer.Mouse.ButtonsSwapped` property: - Provides functionality similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SystemInformation.MouseButtonsSwapped%2A> property.
- Provides information about the computer that runs the code.

Availability by Project Type ||| |-|-| |Project type|Available| |Windows Application|**Yes**| |Class Library|**Yes**| |Console Application|**Yes**| |Windows Control Library|**Yes**| |Web Control Library|No| |Windows Service|**Yes**| |Web Site|No|

A <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> with a value <xref uid="langword_csharp_True" name="True" href=""></xref> if the functionality of the left and right mouse buttons has been swapped; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_False" name="False" href=""></xref>.
The computer has no mouse installed.
Gets a <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> that indicates if the mouse has a scroll wheel.
The `My.Computer.Mouse.WheelExists` property provides functionality similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SystemInformation.MouseWheelPresent%2A> property.

You should check the value of the `My.Computer.Mouse.WheelExists` property before attempting to access the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Mouse.WheelScrollLines%2A> property, which throws an exception if the mouse does not have a scroll wheel.
The `My.Computer.Mouse.WheelExists` property provides information about the computer that runs the code.

Availability by Project Type ||| |-|-| |Project type|Available| |Windows Application|**Yes**| |Class Library|**Yes**| |Console Application|**Yes**| |Windows Control Library|**Yes**| |Web Control Library|No| |Windows Service|**Yes**| |Web Site|No|
A Boolean with value <xref uid="langword_csharp_True" name="True" href=""></xref> if the mouse has a scroll wheel; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_False" name="False" href=""></xref>.
The computer has no mouse installed.
Gets a number that indicates how much to scroll when the mouse wheel is rotated one notch.
You can use this property to determine how many lines to scroll up or down in a multi-line control that has a scroll bar.
The `My.Computer.Mouse.WheelScrollLines` property provides functionality similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SystemInformation.MouseWheelScrollLines%2A> property.
Because this property throws an exception if the mouse does not have a scroll wheel, you should make sure a mouse has a scroll wheel by checking the `My.Computer.Mouse.WheelExists` property.
This property provides information about the computer that runs the code.

Availability by Project Type ||| |-|-| |Project type|Available| |Windows Application|**Yes**| |Class Library|**Yes**| |Console Application|**Yes**| |Windows Control Library|**Yes**| |Web Control Library|No| |Windows Service|**Yes**| |Web Site|No|
An <xref uid="langword_csharp_Integer" name="Integer" href=""></xref> that indicates how much to scroll when the mouse wheel is rotated one notch.
A positive value indicates scrolling by that number of lines, while a negative value indicates scrolling by one screen at a time.
The mouse has no scroll wheel.
